snippet: Doubles players treat points as baseball or football players might, mapping out tactics in advance and using the between-point encounters to prop each other up.
abstract: Conversations between partners in doubles tennis are essential, even if they are often too long for spectators; players at United States Open explain that their discussions are similar to breaks in other sports and are used to map out tactics, such as where to serve; teams also use their brief encounters to support each other and get through difficult periods in the match.
lead_paragraph: Doubles players treat points as baseball or football players might, mapping out tactics in advance and using the between-point encounters to prop each other up.

headline.main: All That Back and Forth at the U.S. Open, Between Doubles Partners
headline.print_headline: All That Back and Forth at the Open, Between Doubles Partners
